meanings.definition: The formation of cavities or bubbles in a liquid, caused by rapid changes in pressure.
meanings.sent1: The fish's swim bladder experienced cavitation when it ascended rapidly in the water.
meanings.sent2: The engineer studied the effects of cavitation on the propeller of the boat.
meanings.sent3: The cavitation in the soda made it fizz uncontrollably, creating a bubbly mess.
meanings.sent4: The cavitation in the waterfall resembled a magical dance of bubbles and foam.
meanings.sent5: The cavitation in the milkshake was so intense that it formed a frothy layer on top.

meanings.definition: The process of cavities forming in a solid material due to repeated stress or vibration.
meanings.sent1: The dentist explained how cavitation can weaken the structure of a tooth over time.
meanings.sent2: The geologist observed cavitation in the rocks caused by seismic activity.
meanings.sent3: The cavitation in the old bridge made it creak and groan like a tired old man.
meanings.sent4: The cavitation in the metal resembled tiny caves forming within the material.
meanings.sent5: The cavitation in the wooden floorboards created a pattern of weakened spots over time.
